page.title: 10YEW TREE FARM - NAILSTONE
page.content: In the middle of Nailstone village is{ {Yew Tree Farm.}It covers 220 acres, 75 acres of which are grass grown for {silage.}This is used for cattle feed after it has stood for 6 weeks. Each cow requires between 6-8 tons each winter. The farm produces 1,000 tons a year. The herd of{cows}is 80 strong with one Limousin bull called Tarquin, who cost 1,600 guineas. There are 85 younger cows called 'followers' and 170 calves. Limousin/Fresian cross calves are fed on milk, rearing pellets, rolled oats, hay and straw and are bred for{beef. Cows are milked in a{milking parlour,} six at a time. Coloured tapes on their tails show how much feed they require. The milk which is thermostatically cooled, flows into a 1700 litre tank with an extra 450 litre reserve tank.
